term.name: organicism
term.source: From Greek organikos: pertaining to or structured like an organ, instrument, or tool.
term.def: The idea that the universe is (or is like) a living organism. This view is similar to &holism;, although holism asserts that all parts of reality are interconnected rather than that the Earth or the universe is a living thing.
The idea (which goes back at least as far as Aristotle) that a work of art should be an organic whole, with all its parts or aspects serving one central purpose.
